field.name: sltbasin
field.longname: Northward Ocean Salt Transport
field.description: function of latitude, basin
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg s-1) northward_ocean_salt_transport : function of latitude, basin **** NEMO-RD: requested is as a function of latitude. In principle, we do not want to translate y into latitude. to be written in meta data

field.name: tos
field.longname: Sea Surface Temperature
field.description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_surface_temperature : temperature of liquid ocean. Note that the correct standard_name for this variable is 'sea_surface_temperature', not 'surface_temperature', but this was discovered too late to correct. To maintain consistency across CMIP5 models, the wrong standard_name will continue to be used. **** NEMO-RD: TODO : JM: is this really requested in K? This does not agree with the .xls document. To be clarified. In NEMO, sst given in Celsius

field.name: sitimefrac
field.longname: Fraction of time steps with sea ice
field.description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell
field.ping_comment: P1 (1.0) sitimefrac : Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

field.name: siconc
field.longname: Sea Ice Area Fraction (Ocean Grid)
field.description: Area fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice
field.ping_comment: P1 (%) sea_ice_area_fraction : Area fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice

field.name: simass
field.longname: Sea-ice mass per area
field.description: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2) sea_ice_amount : Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sithick
field.longname: Sea Ice Thickness
field.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) sea_ice_thickness : Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

field.name: sivol
field.longname: Sea-ice volume per area
field.description: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) sea_ice_thickness : Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

field.name: sisnmass
field.longname: Snow mass per area
field.description: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2) liquid_water_content_of_surface_snow : Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sisnthick
field.longname: Snow thickness
field.description: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) surface_snow_thickness : Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

field.name: siitdconc
field.longname: Sea-ice area fractions in thickness categories
field.description: Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)
field.ping_comment: P3 (%) siitdconc : Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)

field.name: siitdthick
field.longname: Sea-ice thickness in thickness categories
field.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each category (NOT volume divided by grid area), (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)
field.ping_comment: P3 (m) siitdthick : Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each category (NOT volume divided by grid area), (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)

field.name: siitdsnthick
field.longname: Snow thickness in thickness categories
field.description: Actual thickness of snow in each category (NOT volume divided by grid area), (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)
field.ping_comment: P3 (m) siitdsnthick : Actual thickness of snow in each category (NOT volume divided by grid area), (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)

field.name: sitemptop
field.longname: Surface temperature of sea ice
field.description: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.
field.ping_comment: P1 (K) sea_ice_surface_temperature : Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

field.name: sitempsnic
field.longname: Temperature at snow-ice interface
field.description: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero
field.ping_comment: P1 (K) sea_ice_surface_temperature : Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

field.name: sitempbot
field.longname: Temperature at ice-ocean interface
field.description: Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer
field.ping_comment: P2 (K) sitempbot : Report temperature at interface, NOT temperature within lowermost model layer

field.name: siage
field.longname: Age of sea ice
field.description: Age of sea ice
field.ping_comment: P1 (s) age_of_sea_ice : Age of sea ice

field.name: sisaltmass
field.longname: Mass of salt in sea ice per area
field.description: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P3 (kg m-2) sisaltmass : Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sisali
field.longname: Sea ice salinity
field.description: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell
field.ping_comment: P1 (0.001) sea_ice_salinity : Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell

field.name: sifb
field.longname: Sea-ice freeboard
field.description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level
field.ping_comment: P2 (m) sea_ice_freeboard : Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

field.name: sihc
field.longname: Sea-ice heat content per unit area
field.description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water
field.ping_comment: P2 (J m-2) integral_of_sea_ice_temperature_wrt_depth_expressed_as_heat_content : Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water

field.name: sisnhc
field.longname: Snow-heat content per unit area
field.description: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include heat content of sea ice.
field.ping_comment: P2 (J m-2) thermal_energy_content_of_surface_snow : Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include heat content of sea ice.

field.name: siflfwdrain
field.longname: Freshwater flux from sea-ice surface
field.description: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) siflfwdrain : Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive.

field.name: sidconcth
field.longname: sea-ice area fraction change from thermodynamics
field.description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes
field.ping_comment: P2 (s-1) tendency_of_sea_ice_area_fraction_due_to_thermodynamics : Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

field.name: sidconcdyn
field.longname: sea-ice area fraction change from dynamics
field.description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)
field.ping_comment: P2 (s-1) tendency_of_sea_ice_area_fraction_due_to_dynamics : Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)

field.name: sidmassth
field.longname: sea-ice mass change from thermodynamics
field.description: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) sidmassth : Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sidmassdyn
field.longname: sea-ice mass change from dynamics
field.description: Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) sidmassdyn : Total change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection,...) divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sidmassgrowthwat
field.longname: sea-ice mass change through growth in supercooled open water (aka frazil)
field.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) sidmassgrowthwat : The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth

field.name: sidmassgrowthbot
field.longname: sea-ice mass change through basal growth
field.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) tendency_of_sea_ice_amount_due_to_congelation_ice_accumulation : The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.

field.name: sidmasssi
field.longname: sea-ice mass change through snow-to-ice conversion
field.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) tendency_of_sea_ice_amount_due_to_snow_conversion : The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sidmassevapsubl
field.longname: sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation
field.description: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) water_evaporation_flux : The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sidmassmelttop
field.longname: sea-ice mass change through surface melting
field.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) tendency_of_sea_ice_amount_due_to_surface_melting : The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sidmassmeltbot
field.longname: sea-ice mass change through bottom melting
field.description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) tendency_of_sea_ice_amount_due_to_basal_melting : The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sndmasssnf
field.longname: snow mass change through snow fall
field.description: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by sea-ice area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) snowfall_flux : mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sndmassmelt
field.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Melt
field.description: the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by sea-ice area
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) surface_snow_melt_flux : the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sndmasssubl
field.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Evaporation or Sublimation
field.description: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) sndmasssubl : the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sndmassdyn
field.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Avection by Sea-ice Dynamics
field.description: The rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by sea-ice area
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) sndmassdyn : the rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: sndmasssi
field.longname: Snow Mass Rate of Change through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
field.description: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) sndmasssi : the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

field.name: siflsensupbot
field.longname: Net upward sensible heat flux under sea ice
field.description: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean
field.ping_comment: P2 (W m-2) siflsensupbot : the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

field.name: siflcondtop
field.longname: Net conductive heat flux in ice at the surface
field.description: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface
field.ping_comment: P2 (W m-2) siflcondtop : the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface

field.name: siflcondbot
field.longname: Net conductive heat fluxes in ice at the bottom
field.description: the net heat conduction flux at the ice base
field.ping_comment: P2 (W m-2) siflcondbot : the net heat conduction flux at the ice base

field.name: sfdsi
field.longname: Salt flux from sea ice
field.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) downward_sea_ice_basal_salt_flux : This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

field.name: siflfwbot
field.longname: Freshwater flux from sea ice
field.description: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg m-2 s-1) siflfwbot : Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

field.name: siu
field.longname: X-component of sea ice velocity
field.description: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid
field.ping_comment: P1 (m s-1) sea_ice_x_velocity : The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

field.name: siv
field.longname: Y-component of sea ice velocity
field.description: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid
field.ping_comment: P1 (m s-1) sea_ice_y_velocity : The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

field.name: sispeed
field.longname: Sea-ice speed
field.description: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice
field.ping_comment: P1 (m s-1) sea_ice_speed : Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

field.name: sidmasstranx
field.longname: X-component of sea-ice mass transport
field.description: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg s-1) sea_ice_x_transport : Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

field.name: sidmasstrany
field.longname: Y-component of sea-ice mass transport
field.description: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg s-1) sea_ice_y_transport : Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

field.name: sistrxdtop
field.longname: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
field.description: X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
field.ping_comment: P2 (N m-2) surface_downward_x_stress : X-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

field.name: sistrydtop
field.longname: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
field.description: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice
field.ping_comment: P2 (N m-2) surface_downward_y_stress : Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

field.name: sistrxubot
field.longname: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice
field.description: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice
field.ping_comment: P2 (N m-2) sistrxubot : X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

field.name: sistryubot
field.longname: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice
field.description: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice
field.ping_comment: P2 (N m-2) downward_y_stress_at_sea_ice_base : Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

field.name: sicompstren
field.longname: Compressive sea ice strength
field.description: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*hexp(-C(1-A)))
field.ping_comment: P2 (N m-1) compressive_strength_of_sea_ice : Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*hexp(-C(1-A)))

field.name: siforcetiltx
field.longname: Sea-surface tilt term in force balance (x-component)
field.description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-2) siforcetiltx : X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

field.name: siforcetilty
field.longname: Sea-surface tilt term in force balance (y-component)
field.description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-2) siforcetilty : Y-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

field.name: siforcecoriolx
field.longname: Coriolis force term in force balance (x-component)
field.description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-2) siforcecoriolx : X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

field.name: siforcecorioly
field.longname: Coriolis force term in force balance (y-component)
field.description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-2) siforcecorioly : Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

field.name: siforceintstrx
field.longname: Internal stress term in force balance (x-component)
field.description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-2) siforceintstrx : X-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

field.name: siforceintstry
field.longname: Internal stress term in force balance (y-component)
field.description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-2) siforceintstry : Y-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

field.name: sistresave
field.longname: Average normal stress in sea ice
field.description: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-1) sistresave : Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)

field.name: sistremax
field.longname: Maximum shear stress in sea ice
field.description: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)
field.ping_comment: P3 (N m-1) sistremax : Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)

field.name: sidivvel
field.longname: Divergence of the sea-ice velocity field
field.description: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)
field.ping_comment: P2 (s-1) divergence_of_sea_ice_velocity : Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)

field.name: sishevel
field.longname: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field
field.description: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)
field.ping_comment: P2 (s-1) sishevel : Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)

field.name: siextentn
field.longname: Sea ice extent North
field.description: Total area of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice
field.ping_comment: P2 (1e6 km2) sea_ice_extent : Total area of all Northern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

field.name: siextents
field.longname: Sea ice extent South
field.description: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice
field.ping_comment: P2 (1e6 km2) sea_ice_extent : Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

field.name: sivoln
field.longname: Sea ice volume North
field.description: total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere
field.ping_comment: P2 (1e3 km3) sea_ice_volume : total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

field.name: sivols
field.longname: Sea ice volume South
field.description: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere
field.ping_comment: P2 (1e3 km3) sea_ice_volume : total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

field.name: siarean
field.longname: Sea ice area North
field.description: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere
field.ping_comment: P2 (1e6 km2) sea_ice_area : total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

field.name: siareas
field.longname: Sea ice area South
field.description: total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere
field.ping_comment: P2 (1e6 km2) sea_ice_area : total area of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

field.name: simassacrossline
field.longname: Sea mass area flux through straits
field.description: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg s-1) sea_ice_transport_across_line : net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)

field.name: siareaacrossline
field.longname: Sea ice area flux through straits
field.description: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
field.ping_comment: P2 (m2 s-1) siareaacrossline : net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)

field.name: snmassacrossline
field.longname: Snow mass flux through straits
field.description: net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipela
field.ping_comment: P2 (kg s-1) snmassacrossline : net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelego = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)

field.name: masso
field.longname: Sea Water Mass
field.description: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg) sea_water_mass : Total mass of liquid seawater. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

field.name: sf6
field.longname: Mole Concentration of SF6 in sea water
field.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_sulfur_hexafluoride_in_sea_water : Moles Per Unit Mass of SF6 in sea water **** NEMO-RD: does not do

field.name: cfc11
field.longname: Mole Concentration of CFC-11 in sea water
field.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name fof CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_cfc11_in_sea_water : Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name fof CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

field.name: pbo
field.longname: Sea Water Pressure at Sea floor
field.description: 'Sea water pressure' is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water. It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.
field.ping_comment: P1 (Pa) sea_water_pressure_at_sea_floor : Sea Water Pressure at Sea floor

field.name: cfc12
field.longname: Mole Concentration of CFC-12 in sea water
field.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_cfc12_in_sea_water : Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for CFC12 is CF2Cl2. The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

field.name: dissicos
field.longname: Surface Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
field.description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_dissolved_inorganic_carbon_in_sea_water : Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

field.name: fgsf6
field.longname: Surface Downward SF6 flux
field.description: gas exchange flux of SF6
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol sec-1 m-2) fgsf6 : gas exchange flux of SF6

field.name: volo
field.longname: Sea Water Volume
field.description: Total volume of liquid sea water.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m3) sea_water_volume : Total volume of liquid seawater.

field.name: fgcfc11
field.longname: Surface Downward CFC11 flux
field.description: gas exchange flux of CFC11
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol sec-1 m-2) surface_downward_mole_flux_of_cfc11 : gas exchange flux of CFC11

field.name: zos
field.longname: Sea Surface Height Above Geoid
field.description: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) sea_surface_height_above_geoid : This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.

field.name: fgcfc12
field.longname: Surface Downward CFC12 flux
field.description: gas exchange flux of CFC12
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol sec-1 m-2) surface_downward_mole_flux_of_cfc12 : gas exchange flux of CFC12

field.name: zossq
field.longname: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid
field.description: Surface ocean geoid defines z=0.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m2) square_of_sea_surface_height_above_geoid : Surface ocean geoid defines z=0.

field.name: zostoga
field.longname: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
field.description: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) global_average_thermosteric_sea_level_change : There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

field.name: dissocos
field.longname: Surface Dissolved Organic Carbon Concentration
field.description: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_dissolved_organic_carbon_in_sea_water : Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

field.name: masscello
field.longname: Sea Water Mass Per Unit Area
field.description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2) sea_water_mass_per_unit_area : Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

field.name: phycos
field.longname: Surface Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration
field.description: sum of phytoplankton organic carbon component concentrations at the sea surface
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_phytoplankton_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations. In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., 'Diatom Carbon Concentration' and 'Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration'

field.name: thkcello
field.longname: Ocean Model Cell Thickness
field.description: 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer. 'Cell' refers to a model grid-cell.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) cell_thickness : Ocean Model Cell Thickness

field.description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_water_potential_temperature : Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_water_potential_temperature : Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field

field.description: Sea water conservative temperature (this should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field)
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_water_conservative_temperature : Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_organic_detritus_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

field.description: Diagnostic should be contributed only for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_calcite_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

field.name: tos
field.longname: Sea Surface Temperature
field.description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_surface_temperature : temperature of liquid ocean. Note that the correct standard_name for this variable is 'sea_surface_temperature', not 'surface_temperature', but this was discovered too late to correct. field.description: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_water_potential_temperature_at_sea_floor : Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.

field.name: tosga
field.longname: Global Average Sea Surface Temperature
field.description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC) sea_surface_temperature : This may differ from 'surface temperature' in regions of sea ice.This may differ from 'surface temperature' in regions of sea ice.For models using conservative temperature as prognostic field, they should report the SST as surface potent

field.name: tossq
field.longname: Square of Sea Surface Temperature
field.description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean.
field.ping_comment: P1 (degC2) square_of_sea_surface_temperature : square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

field.name: so
field.longname: Sea Water Salinity
field.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand. There are standard names for the more precisely defined salinity quantities: sea_water_knudsen_salinity, S_K (used for salinity observations between 1901 and 1966), sea_water_cox_salinity, S_C (used for salinity observations between 1967 and 1977), sea_water_practical_salinity, S_P (used for salinity observations from 1978 to the present day), sea_water_absolute_salinity, S_A, sea_water_preformed_salinity, S_*, and sea_water_reference_salinity. Practical Salinity is reported on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978 (PSS-78), and is usually based on the electrical conductivity of sea water in observations since the 1960s.
field.ping_comment: P1 (0.001) sea_water_salinity : Sea Water Salinity

field.name: phymiscos
field.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton expressed as Carbon in sea water
field.description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_miscellaneous_phytoplankton_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

field.name: soga
field.longname: Global Mean Sea Water Salinity
field.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand. There are standard names for the more precisely defined salinity quantities: sea_water_knudsen_salinity, S_K (used for salinity observations between 1901 and 1966), sea_water_cox_salinity, S_C (used for salinity observations between 1967 and 1977), sea_water_practical_salinity, S_P (used for salinity observations from 1978 to the present day), sea_water_absolute_salinity, S_A, sea_water_preformed_salinity, S_*, and sea_water_reference_salinity. Practical Salinity is reported on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978 (PSS-78), and is usually based on the electrical conductivity of sea water in observations since the 1960s.
field.ping_comment: P1 (0.001) sea_water_salinity : Global Mean Sea Water Salinity

field.name: sos
field.longname: Sea Surface Salinity
field.description: Sea surface salinity is the salt content of sea water close to the sea surface, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand. Sea surface salinity is often abbreviated as 'SSS'. For the salinity of sea water at a particular depth or layer, a data variable of 'sea_water_salinity' or one of the more precisely defined salinities should be used with a vertical coordinate axis.
field.ping_comment: P1 (0.001) sea_surface_salinity : Sea Surface Salinity

field.name: zmicroos
field.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton expressed as Carbon in sea water
field.description: carbon concentration from the microzooplankton (less then 20 um) component alone
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_microzooplankton_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : carbon concentration from the microzooplankton (less then 20 um) component alone

field.name: sob
field.longname: sea water salinity at sea floor
field.description: Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell
field.ping_comment: P1 (0.001) sob : Model prognostic salinity at bottom-most model grid cell

field.name: zmesoos
field.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton expressed as Carbon in sea water
field.description: carbon concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_mesozooplankton_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : carbon concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

field.name: sosga
field.longname: Global Average Sea Surface Salinity
field.description: Sea surface salinity is the salt content of sea water close to the sea surface, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand. Sea surface salinity is often abbreviated as 'SSS'. For the salinity of sea water at a particular depth or layer, a data variable of 'sea_water_salinity' or one of the more precisely defined salinities should be used with a vertical coordinate axis.
field.ping_comment: P1 (0.001) sea_surface_salinity : Global Average Sea Surface Salinity

field.name: sossq
field.longname: Square of Sea Surface Salinity
field.description: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. Sea surface salinity is the salt concentration of sea water close to the sea surface, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand. Sea surface salinity is often abbreviated as 'SSS'. For the salinity of sea water at a particular depth or layer, a data variable of 'sea_water_salinity' or one of the more precisely defined salinities should be used with a vertical coordinate axis.
field.ping_comment: P3 (1e-06) sossq : Square of Sea Surface Salinity

field.name: talkos
field.longname: Surface Total Alkalinity
field.description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) sea_water_alkalinity_expressed_as_mole_equivalent : total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)

field.name: agessc
field.longname: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
field.description: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.
field.ping_comment: P1 (yr) sea_water_age_since_surface_contact : Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.

field.name: msftbarot
field.longname: Ocean Barotropic Mass Streamfunction
field.description: Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg s-1) ocean_barotropic_mass_streamfunction : Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.

field.name: phos
field.longname: Surface pH
field.description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.
field.ping_comment: P1 (1) sea_water_ph_reported_on_total_scale : negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

field.name: mlotst
field.longname: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
field.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
field.ping_comment: P2 (m) ocean_mixed_layer_thickness_defined_by_sigma_t : Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

field.name: mlotstsq
field.longname: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
field.description: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by 'temperature', 'sigma', 'sigma_theta', 'sigma_t' or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea_water_sigma_t_difference can be used to specify the sigma_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. 'Thickness' means the vertical extent of a layer.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m2) square_of_ocean_mixed_layer_thickness_defined_by_sigma_t : Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

field.name: mlotstmax
field.longname: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
field.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.
field.ping_comment: P1 (m) ocean_mixed_layer_thickness_defined_by_sigma_t : Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

field.name: o2os
field.longname: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration

A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water : 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, whereX is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'.

field.name: no3os

field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_nitrate_in_sea_water : Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

field.name: obvfsq
field.longname: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water
field.description: The phrase 'square_of_X' means X*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called 'buoyancy frequency' and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.
field.ping_comment: P1 (s-2) obvfsq : Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water

field.name: nh4os

field.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. field.name: physios

field.description: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations

field.name: co3os
field.longname: Surface Carbonate Ion Concentration
field.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, whereX is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with a charge of minus two.
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_carbonate_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, whereX is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with a charge of minus two.

field.description: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W) ocean_heat_x_transport : Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

field.name: co3satcalcos
field.longname: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in sea water
field.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with an electrical charge of minus two. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. At a given salinity, the thermodynamic equilibrium is that between dissolved carbonate ion and solid calcite. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.
field.ping_comment: P2 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_carbonate_expressed_as_carbon_at_equilibrium_with_pure_calcite_in_sea_water : Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with an electrical charge of minus two. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. At a given salinity, the thermodynamic equilibrium is that between dissolved carbonate ion and solid calcite. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

field.name: mfo
field.longname: Sea Water Transport
field.description: Transport across_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport.

field.longname: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea

field.description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

field.name: fsitherm
field.longname: Water Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics

field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) water_flux_into_sea_water_due_to_sea_ice_thermodynamics : computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. **** Duplication with SIMIP (siflfwbot + sndmassmelt) but mail to Dirk Notz and Martin Jukes suggest to keep as it is. NEMO-RD : a more appropriate definition is : total freswhater flux into ocean due to sea ice and associated snow cover.

field.name: wfo
field.longname: Water Flux into Sea Water
field.description: computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum of the next two variables in this table.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) water_flux_into_sea_water : computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum of the next two variables in this table.

field.name: wfcorr
field.longname: Water Flux Correction
field.description: Positive flux implies correction adds water to ocean.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) water_flux_correction : Positive flux implies correction adds water to ocean.

field.name: sfdsi
field.longname: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
field.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) downward_sea_ice_basal_salt_flux : This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

field.name: hfgeou
field.longname: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
field.description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) upward_geothermal_heat_flux_at_sea_floor : Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor

field.name: hfrainds
field.longname: Temperature Flux due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
field.description: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) temperature_flux_due_to_rainfall_expressed_as_heat_flux_into_sea_water : This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.

field.name: hfevapds
field.longname: Temperature Flux due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux Out of Sea Water
field.description: This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) temperature_flux_due_to_evaporation_expressed_as_heat_flux_out_of_sea_water : This is defined as 'where ice_free_sea over sea'

field.name: hfrunoffds2d
field.longname: Temperature Flux due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
field.description: Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage. The quantity with standard name temperature_flux_due_to_runoff_expressed_as_heat_flux_into_sea_water is the heat carried by the transfer of water into the liquid ocean by the process of runoff. This quantity additonally includes melt water from sea ice and icebergs. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius. It is calculated as the product QrunoffCpTrunoff, where Q runoff is the mass flux of liquid runoff entering the sea water (kg m-2 s-1), Cp is the specific heat capacity of water, and Trunoff is the temperature in degrees Celsius of the runoff water. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
field.ping_comment: P2 (W m-2) temperature_flux_due_to_runoff_expressed_as_heat_flux_into_sea_water : Temperature Flux due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

field.name: hfsnthermds2d
field.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Snow Thermodynamics
field.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Snow thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
field.ping_comment: P2 (W m-2) heat_flux_into_sea_water_due_to_snow_thermodynamics : Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Snow Thermodynamics

field.name: hfibthermds2d
field.longname: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
field.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. ' Iceberg thermodynamics' refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) heat_flux_into_sea_water_due_to_iceberg_thermodynamics : Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

field.name: rsntds
field.longname: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
field.description: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) net_downward_shortwave_flux_at_sea_water_surface : This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

field.name: rsdo
field.longname: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
field.description: Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) downwelling_shortwave_flux_in_sea_water : Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water

field.name: hfcorr
field.longname: Heat Flux Correction
field.description: Flux correction is also called 'flux adjustment'. A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.
field.ping_comment: P0 (W m-2) heat_flux_correction : Heat Flux Correction **** NEMO-RD: not relevant for IPSLCM6

field.name: hfds
field.longname: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
field.description: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') .
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) surface_downward_heat_flux_in_sea_water : This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any 'flux adjustment') .

field.name: graz
field.longname: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
field.description: 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3 s-1) tendency_of_mole_concentration_of_particulate_organic_matter_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water_due_to_grazing_of_phytoplankton : 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. Phytoplankton are autotrophic prokaryotic or eukaryotic algae that live near the water surface where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Grazing of phytoplankton' means the grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton.

field.longname: Sinking Particulate Organic Carbon Flux
field.description: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-2 s-1) sinking_mole_flux_of_particulate_organic_matter_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : Downward flux of particulate organic carbon

field.name: limndiaz
field.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Diazotrophs
field.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
field.ping_comment: P1 (1) nitrogen_growth_limitation_of_diazotrophs : In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

field.name: limnmisc
field.longname: Nitrogen Limitation of Other Phytoplankton
field.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. 'Miscellaneous phytoplankton' are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. 'Nitrogen growth limitation' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.
field.ping_comment: P1 (1) nitrogen_growth_limitation_of_miscellaneous_phytoplankton : Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. field.name: limirrdiat
field.longname: Irradiance Limitation of Diatoms
field.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Irradiance' means the power per unit area (called radiative flux in other standard names), the area being normal to the direction of flow of the radiant energy. Solar irradiance is essential to the photosynthesis reaction and its presence promotes the growth of phytoplankton populations. 'Growth limitation due to solar irradiance' means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

field.longname: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
field.description: The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-2 s-1) sinking_mole_flux_of_particulate_organic_matter_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. field.name: spco2
field.longname: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
field.description: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.
field.ping_comment: P1 (Pa) surface_partial_pressure_of_carbon_dioxide_in_sea_water : The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

field.description: Vertically integrated nitrogen fixation
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-2 s-1) tendency_of_ocean_mole_content_of_elemental_nitrogen_due_to_fixation : Vertically integrated nitrogen fixation

field.name: fsn
field.longname: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen
field.description: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is asingle term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. Deposition of nitrogen into the ocean is the sum of dry and wet depositionof nitrogen species onto the ocean surface from the atmosphere. 'Nitrogen fixation' means the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas. Organisms that fix nitrogen are termed 'diazotrophs'. Diazotrophic phytoplankton can fix atmospheric nitrogen, thus increasing the content of nitrogen in the ocean. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-2 s-1) tendency_of_ocean_mole_content_of_elemental_nitrogen_due_to_deposition_and_fixation_and_runoff : 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is asingle term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. Deposition of nitrogen into the ocean is the sum of dry and wet depositionof nitrogen species onto the ocean surface from the atmosphere. 'Nitrogen fixation' means the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas. Organisms that fix nitrogen are termed 'diazotrophs'. Diazotrophic phytoplankton can fix atmospheric nitrogen, thus increasing the content of nitrogen in the ocean. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time.

field.name: o2min
field.longname: Oxygen Minimum Concentration
field.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean. A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_dissolved_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile : 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The concentration of any chemical species, whether particulate or dissolved, may vary with depth in the ocean. A depth profile may go through one or more local minima in concentration. The mole_concentration_of_molecular_oxygen_in_sea_water_at_shallowest_local_minimum_in_vertical_profile is the mole concentration of oxygen at the local minimum in the concentration profile that occurs closest to the sea surface.

field.name: co3
field.longname: Carbonate Ion Concentration
field.description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, whereX is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with a charge of minus two.
field.ping_comment: P1 (mol m-3) mole_concentration_of_carbonate_expressed_as_carbon_in_sea_water : 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called'molarity', and is used in the construction mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y, whereX is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with a charge of minus two.

field.name: co3satcalc
field.longname: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in sea water
field.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called 'molarity', and is used in the construction 'mole_concentration_of_X_in_Y', where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with an electrical charge of minus two. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. At a given salinity, the thermodynamic equilibrium is that between dissolved carbonate ion and solid calcite. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox_expressed_as_nitrogen'. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. field.name: ocontemprmadvect
field.longname: tendency of sea water conservative temperature expressed as heat content due to residual mean (sum of Eulerian +
field.description: 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as_heat_content' means that this quantity is calculated as the specific heat capacity times density of sea water multiplied by the conservative temperature of the sea water in the grid cell. Conservative Temperature is defined as part of the Thermodynamic Equation of Seawater 2010 (TEOS-10) which was adopted in 2010 by the International Oceanographic Commission (IOC). Conservative Temperature is specific potential enthalpy (which has the standard name sea_water_specific_potential_enthalpy) divided by a fixed value of the specific heat capacity of sea water, namely cp_0 = 3991.86795711963 J kg-1 K-1. Conservative Temperature is a more accurate measure of the 'heat content' of sea water, by a factor of one hundred, than is potential temperature. Because of this, it can be regarded as being proportional to the heat content of sea water per unit mass. Reference: www.teos-10.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) ocontemprmadvect : Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content due to Residual Mean Advection

field.name: osaltrmadvect
field.longname: tendency of sea water salinity expressed as salt content due to residual mean advection
field.description: The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due_to_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. The phrase 'residual_mean_advection' refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.
field.ping_comment: P1 (kg m-2 s-1) osaltrmadvect : Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content due to Residual Mean Advection

The chemical formula of the carbonate anion is CO3 with an electrical charge of minus two. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. At a given salinity, the thermodynamic equilibrium is that between dissolved carbonate ion and solid calcite. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

field.name: ocontemptend
field.longname: tendency of sea water conservative temperature expressed as heat content
field.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) ocontemptend : Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.name: ocontemprmadvect
field.longname: tendency of sea water conservative temperature expressed as heat content due to residual mean (sum of Eulerian +
field.description: 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as_heat_content' means that this quantity is calculated as the specific heat capacity times density of sea water multiplied by the conservative temperature of the sea water in the grid cell. Conservative Temperature is defined as part of the Thermodynamic Equation of Seawater 2010 (TEOS-10) which was adopted in 2010 by the International Oceanographic Commission (IOC). Conservative Temperature is specific potential enthalpy (which has the standard name sea_water_specific_potential_enthalpy) divided by a fixed value of the specific heat capacity of sea water, namely cp_0 = 3991.86795711963 J kg-1 K-1. Conservative Temperature is a more accurate measure of the 'heat content' of sea water, by a factor of one hundred, than is potential temperature. Because of this, it can be regarded as being proportional to the heat content of sea water per unit mass. Reference: www.teos-10.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) ocontemprmadvect : Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content due to Residual Mean Advection

field.name: ocontemppadvect

field.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.
field.ping_comment: P1 (W m-2) ocontemppadvect : Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

field.longname: tendency of sea water salinity expressed as salt content
field.description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.
